Package mpmToolbox.projectData.audio

Class Audio

  • java.lang.Object
    • meico.audio.Audio
      • mpmToolbox.projectData.audio.Audio
  • public class Audio
extends meico.audio.Audio
    This class represents audio data in an MPM Toolbox project. It extends meico's Audio class and adds some more elaborate waveform and spectrogram image provider functionality. It also adds alignment data.
    Author:
    Axel Berndt

      • convertWaveform2Image

        public java.awt.image.BufferedImage convertWaveform2Image​(int channelNumber,
                                                          int leftmostSample,
                                                          int rightmostSample,
                                                          int width,
                                                          int height)
                                                   throws java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException
        Make a waveform image from the input audio data. This is an optimized version of the same method in meico.audio.Audio.
        Parameters:
        channelNumber - the audio channel to be rendered
        leftmostSample - where in the audio data should we start
        rightmostSample - where in the audio will we end
        width - the width of the image in pixels
        height - the height of the image in pixels
        Returns:
        the waveform image or null
        Throws:
        java.lang.ArrayIndexOutOfBoundsException

        public WaveformImage getWaveformImage()
        getter for the waveform image
        Returns:

      • exportConstantQTransformSpectrogram

        public java.util.ArrayList<com.tagtraum.jipes.audio.LogFrequencySpectrum> exportConstantQTransformSpectrogram​(com.tagtraum.jipes.math.WindowFunction windowFunction,
                                                                                                              int hopSize,
                                                                                                              float minFrequency,
                                                                                                              float maxFrequency,
                                                                                                              int binsPerSemitone,
                                                                                                              com.tagtraum.jipes.SignalPump<com.tagtraum.jipes.audio.AudioBuffer> pump,
                                                                                                              com.alee.extended.window.WebProgressDialog progressBar)
                                                                                                       throws java.io.IOException
        This computes a Contant Q Transform spectrogram and returns it as array of CQT slices.
        Parameters:
        windowFunction -
        hopSize -
        minFrequency -
        maxFrequency -
        binsPerSemitone -
        pump - In other dsp frameworks the pump might be called dispatcher, it delivers the audio frames. The application can provide its own pump. Via the pump the application can cancel the processing which is useful in multithreaded environments.
        progressBar - the progress bar to be updated and display the progress
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • computeSpectrogram

        public boolean computeSpectrogram​(com.tagtraum.jipes.math.WindowFunction windowFunction,
                                  int hopSize,
                                  float minFrequency,
                                  float maxFrequency,
                                  int binsPerSemitone,
                                  boolean normalize,
                                  com.tagtraum.jipes.SignalPump<com.tagtraum.jipes.audio.AudioBuffer> pump,
                                  com.alee.extended.window.WebProgressDialog progressBar)
        This triggers the computation of the spectrogram, and it's rendering to a SpectrogramImage. It can take some time!
        Parameters:
        windowFunction -
        hopSize -
        minFrequency -
        maxFrequency -
        binsPerSemitone -
        normalize -
        pump - the audio frame dispatcher
        progressBar -
        Returns:
        true if image has changed
